description:
If the original image A size is 123456, then deploy an instance B based on the image A. Next capture an image C based on the instance B. As a result, the size of image C will be 0. 

After investigation, I think the root cause is the meta data is never updated  during snapshot. See this: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/hyperv/snapshotops.py#L45
title: Hyper-V: Captured image size is 0

comments.content:
If the original image A size is 123456, then deploy an instance B based on the image A. Next capture an image C based on the instance B. As a result, the size of image C will be 0. 

After investigation, I think the root cause is the meta data is never updated  during snapshot. See this: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/hyperv/snapshotops.py#L45
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~flwang

comments.content: After the deeper investigation, we found the root cause is the snapshot is recognized as volume based even it's a local disk based. So the size is updated as 0.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~flwang

comments.content: This bug has been fixed in the latest master branch. Please refer to the code review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33295/
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yuyangbj
